The horn landed on the planet millenia ago, crashing into the side of a
mountain creating a huge crater. Its presence in the planet is what
explains the large concentration of phenomena happening specifically there
throughout the story. Trivia The idea of a horn being involved in the game
stems from the original Defense of the Ancients custom map for Warcraft 3,
which has the sound of a horn play at the start of a match. This same
element was preserved in the mod's sequel, Dota 2. The Arhus is partially
inspired by Heimdall in Norse mythology, who wielded the Gjallarhorn and
blew it to warn the gods of the start of Ragnarok, much like how the Arhus
is sounded at the start of a match. An interpretation of the name
"Gjallarhorn" is to mean "horn of the river Gjöll". In Norse mythology,
Gjöll is the river that separates the living from the dead, much like how
the Arhus has powers over life. Other than a musical instrument, horns
were historically also used as a drinking vessel, relating to . Heimdall
uses the Gjallarhorn to drink from the Mímisbrunnr to gain wisdom. Blowing
the Arhus is akin to drinking the waters of life. The name "Arhus" comes
from the river Aarhus in Jutland (Denmark), and roughly means "river
mouth". fountain of youth, water of life olifant/oliphant instrument The
Ohrn is a cosmogonic relic of insurmountable power which acts as the
tournament’s “artefact of attraction”. With its stalwart metal body and
elegant curves it guides the design of most of the game’s visual elements,
from architecture to interfaces. Its magic is divine in nature and
manifests as golden beams of energy, representing the vital energy that
flows through every living being. Sound can be heard across the universe.
